Average Congestion Rate (ACR) --- A weighted average of the congestion rates for the top 50 container ports worldwide, with the weights determined by the number of ship visits to each port:

children.label: acr
children.html: ACRt=∑p∈P[Delayedpt+Undelayedpt∑p∈P(Delayedpt+Undelayedpt)⋅Congestionpt],ACR_t = \sum_{p \in \mathcal{P}} \left[ \frac{Delayed_{pt} + Undelayed_{pt}}{\sum_{p \in \mathcal{P}} \left( Delayed_{pt} + Undelayed_{pt} \right)} \cdot Congestion_{pt} \right],ACRt​=p∈P∑​[∑p∈P​(Delayedpt​+Undelayedpt​)Delayedpt​+Undelayedpt​​⋅Congestionpt​],

children.value: where the congestion rate for each port

children.html: p∈Pp \in \mathcal{P}p∈P

children.value: is computed by dividing the number of delayed ship visits by the total number of ship visits:

children.label: congestion_rate_for_a_port
children.html: Congestionpt≡DelayedptDelayedpt+Undelayedpt,∀p∈P.Congestion_{pt} \equiv \frac{Delayed_{pt}}{Delayed_{pt} + Undelayed_{pt}}, \quad \forall p \in \mathcal{P}.Congestionpt​≡Delayedpt​+Undelayedpt​Delayedpt​​,∀p∈P.
DelayedptDelayed_{pt}Delayedpt​
UndelayedptUndelayed_{pt}Undelayedpt​

children.value: represent the number of delayed and undelayed ship visits at port

children.value: , respectively. The full list of the top 50 container ports can be accessed using the following link:

Average Congestion Time (ACT) --- The average number of hours a container ship waits in an anchorage area of a port before docking at a berth, weighted by the number of ship visits to the top 50 container ports worldwide:

children.label: ACT
children.html: ACTt=∑p∈P[Delayedpt+Undelayedpt∑p∈P(Delayedpt+Undelayedpt)⋅DelayHoursptDelayedpt+Undelayedpt],ACT_t = \sum_{p \in \mathcal{P}} \left[ \frac{Delayed_{pt} + Undelayed_{pt}}{\sum_{p \in \mathcal{P}} \left( Delayed_{pt} + Undelayed_{pt} \right)} \cdot \frac{DelayHours_{pt}}{Delayed_{pt} + Undelayed_{pt}} \right],ACTt​=p∈P∑​[∑p∈P​(Delayedpt​+Undelayedpt​)Delayedpt​+Undelayedpt​​⋅Delayedpt​+Undelayedpt​DelayHourspt​​],
DelayHoursptDelayHours_{pt}DelayHourspt​

children.value: represents the total number of hours that container ships spend in the anchorage areas of port

children.html: ppp
ttt

children.value: The identification of berth and anchorage areas in each port is achieved through the application of the IMA-DBSCAN algorithm, i.e., the Iterative, Multi-Attribute, Density-Based Spatial Clustering of Applications with Noise. The details and pseudo-code can be found in
The monthly series of the ACR and ACT indices can be downloaded using the following link:

. Additionally, the disaggregated monthly series of congestion rates for the top 50 container ports (except for the Ports of Yingkou, Foshan, and Nantong in China) can be downloaded using the following link:

These three ports are excluded because their AIS trajectories did not overlap with the available berth polygons, or because their port names could not be reliably matched to corresponding berth polygons. All other ports in the global top 50 are included, ensuring comprehensive coverage of congestion conditions among the world’s major container ports.
